intro: Plagiogyria japonica var. japonica, commonly known as Japanese plagiogyria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its upright, branched stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The leaves are typically ovate to elliptical in shape, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. This plant is native to East Asia, particularly Japan, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
